website_summaries.verdict: Simple camera stabilizer that provides a high level of quality, while being extremely easy to use.
pros: Will work with many different types of cameras, including smartphones and GoPro models, up to 2.1 pounds
Allows you to use the handle in your hand or the apparatus balanced against your shoulder, so it's as comfortable as possible
Easy to use while you're on the move
cons: May be difficult to dial in the precise pan and tilt measurements that you want

customer_reviews.title: It's the end of rock 'n roll.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Roxant Video Stabilizer out of curiosity, more than anything else, to understand how it works. The purpose of this video was to see if something this simple and inexpensive can really work. I was surprised how effective it was - especially when comparing videos taken with and without the Roxant. The unit is very well made – not cheaply construction. Make sure you do a good job balancing the camera on the stabilizer. It may take a little time on the first try, but your efforts will be well rewarded.
customer_reviews.author: Lance S. Micklus

customer_reviews.title: It's like trying to figure out the formula to a math ...
customer_reviews.text: I've watched countless videos on how to stabilize this thing & I just can't get it to work for me. Besides it's way to much adjusting you have to do from the weights, to the handle, to having to decide which hole to put the silver piece in. It's like trying to figure out the formula to a math equation when all I want to do is capture some good footage. Two words I'LL PASS! Think I'm going to have to just make the $740 investment for the Zhiyun Crane 2. I don't have time for this!
customer_reviews.author: Dorsey

customer_reviews.title: Great Stabilizer, Great Price, Amazing Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: I am using my Roxant Stabilizer for music video projects and promotional material (I am a musical artist by trade and an aspiring filmmaker. All I am currently stabilizing is a Nikon D5300. I love the design, weight, and color! One thing that would be awesome would be a built in loop to attach a carabiner to so that I could carry the camera/stabilizer rig hands-free. The construction feels very solid. I am currently wrapping my first full-length music video (attached above). And the customer service I received on a very small issue was taken care of with the utmost care and personal attention. Thank you so much for a great experience!
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Cheng

customer_reviews.title: "Meh" is the perfect word.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, if you're looking to invest money in a stabilizer, I wouldn't go this route. I played around with the weight system for an hour before every shoot and nothing seemed to perfectly stabilize it. Plus, I get an array of shots at different angles and speeds, this was not able to handle that. If you want a stabilizer, get a motorized gimbal. It will be a bit more expensive, but it will make a 100% different, especially compared to this thing. If you do just want to do a couple of shots where you walk really slow, you could probably make this work.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J. Chwalik

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for wrong size piece.
customer_reviews.text: The part that connects the handle bar and the stabilizer itself doesn't match. I don't know the actual name of that piece. It's the joint piece that moves around and it has the RoXant logo on. For some reason that piece is smaller. I think someone made a mistake and put in the wrong piece in my box. I called the Amazon tech support at 10pm because I want to use this for my trip that's coming up in three days. Hopefully the replacement will get here in time and of the correct size part!
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Adjusting camera holder to get a perfect balance is beyond me....  BUT.....
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well.... image is pretty stable... How do I know ??? It looks fairly stable... Not like some of the folks on U-Tube but close... I surely won't puke watching my videos... I'm sure I will get better at this video thing doing 3 or 4 a year.... They sent me, for FREE, and upgraded handle and gimble mount... sure is nice... Much better and more comfortable handle... More control also.... It's contoured to fit your hand mo-betta... I like it.. An electric gyro will give a more stable picture... I don't need that... too much $$$$... to keep me from puking, this unit is perfect...
customer_reviews.author: DAVEWASHINGTON

customer_reviews.title: works good with mirrorless cams
customer_reviews.text: I had to watch the tutorial videos to get the gist and concepts of how to fine tune and balance the gear and it worked great for a canon m6 with rode mic attached. it takes me more than five minutes to fine tune it though - like a lot more than five minutes lol. just remember that subtle adjustments make a big difference. it's not as smooth as an electric one but it does the job for modest movements. i'm mostly as stills photographer so decided to get a less pricey option for doing video from time to time and this fits the bill.
customer_reviews.author: gearheadskyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Not for me

I don't think it will work for my situation, I shoot videos at car events which can get very busy and I feel like this item would take some time to get used to and a bit of patience to get the stability correct. I ended up returning it and will find a motorized one that may cost a bit more but will hopefully be more user-friendly. Also one of the threads was all chewed up on the inside so I was unable to screw in the camera base in the center for balancing.

customer_reviews.title: Good manual gimble
customer_reviews.text: Was finally able to use this on my GoPro 8. Even with the weight, it did not tire my hand out too much. The biggest problem with the Gimble is it is hard to get the balance exactly right. And by balance I mean the speed at which the Gimble self balances, and the shake the balance has. But overall, it did what it was supposed to do at a fraction of the price of electronic Gimbles. And when you are in an area with limited to no electricity, sometimes manual is good.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal Hiker and ProspectorTop Contributor: Hiking

customer_reviews.title: Good budget stabilizer
customer_reviews.text: I decided to give this steady cam a shot and see if it would work for my needs which is small action sequences. overall it stabilizes decently once you have it adjusted for your camera. I found the adjustment easier on smaller devices like a phone or point and shoot camera (it includes a phone mount). For my larger camera setup this process was more difficult, but still doable. The real pro to this device is that it does stabilize your camera without requiring batteries or fancy apps.

customer_reviews.text: I just finished setting up the stabilizer. I set it up first with the smartphone and the video helped because it recommended using washer for lighter camera in this case smartphone. customer_reviews.author: Ansi Cartman

customer_reviews.title: Not for heavier cameras
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for cameras that do not go above it's weight limit, or near it's weight limit. You get really good stable video. Not AS crisp as an actual electronic stabilizer but it's real close. I'd say it's just as difficult to get this thing balanced as an electronic one. Maybe a little harder, I don' t know. I don't use stabilizers much. They're really annoying to bring around. Just invest in good lens and a camera body that doesn't have so much shake! There are tips you can research on how to walk to achieve more stable video.
customer_reviews.author: juno

customer_reviews.title: An unexpected delight
customer_reviews.text: I am using this personally and professionally. I want to capture family events, such as our annual Easter egg hunt with our grandchildren and other family get-togethers. Professionally I am a drug and alcohol counselor working with at-risk students in middle and high school settings. We use video as a teaching tool and to memorialize events. I love the design. Simple but effective. And the cost makes it viable for any video enthusiast. The material is high quality and looks great, nothing cheap or slapped together. I am very happy to have purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: Mfmcgins

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well for the price
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used the Roxant Pro on 3 or 4 shoots so far. The quality of the materials and craftsmanship are top notch! I do have some issues with it though. Even with the camera perfectly balanced and dialed in, the stabilizer often struggles to keep up, especially with sudden movements. If you’re on a tight budget this can work for you, just be sure to keep your hands steady and plan your shots so you can do them as slow and controlled as possible. My only other critique is that the rig plus my Nikon DSLR starts to feel heavy after 10-15 minutes. This would probably be best if used with a GoPro or phone.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Ann Harmon J

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service and great gear
customer_reviews.text: Customer service is amazing. I emailed them about how I go about the upgraded handle from what I had. They got back to me same day and are shipping me out the handle right away. I do like the product though it is challenging to balance. I finally got my iPhone balanced and love what it can do. I do video and was looking for a stabilizer that was lighter and cheaper to use then the gimbal and this is it!!
customer_reviews.author: Tami

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, Sturdy Solution
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was considerably cheaper than a gimbal. Works fine with a cell phone or small camera. I crossed my fingers and hoped that it would work for a heavier camera, but it's awkward and difficult to get a smooth shot. It did say this is for cameras that are "up to 2.1 lbs", so I can't complain. I modified the weight system so that I can make it heavier, which does help with a larger camera.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Roxant Video Camera Stabilizer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Black Pro edition to assist in my family and travel videos. Shipping on the product thru Amazon was VERY fast. Ordered on Friday and I had it Sunday evening. Packaging was sufficient, despite some minor damage to the box. The Roxant Video Camera Stabilizer appears to be a well thought out and efficient product. It feels solid in the hand and operates smoothly. Smart application of rubberized surfaces keeps slippage to a minimum. There is a steep leaning curve that I have not gotten over yet, learning how to balance properly, but I am confidant that with some more practice I will overcome that. Overall I am happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Pope Broken III

customer_reviews.title: Good stabilizer, should come with quick release
customer_reviews.text: I’ve just begun working on short films and plan to use this for some shots. I use a Canon Rebel SL2. Later this year I will be participating in the Portland 48 Hour Film project and I’m hoping this gimbal will help me to capture better video. I like the color, weight and size. So far the design seems fine but I suppose time will tell. I would have liked if it came ready with a quick release or some way of keeping the locking screw on the top in place once the sweet spot for the camera is found, rather than having to find it again every time I remove and then reattach the camera. Overall I’m satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Jason S.

customer_reviews.title: OK, hard to use in my opinion but good quality

It is very sturdy, and seems to be of good quality, but it's hard to get it stabilized properly as well as level. Overall, it's somewhat frustrating to use, in my humble opinion.

I was initially very excited to use this when I first bought it a few years ago but since then I have only used it a small handful of times before I went ahead and upgraded to a motorized gimbal.

I like that it is simple and hard to break.

I bought this product to use in house walkthroughs so that I could easily move from room to room without the shaking or tilting. A stabilizer is a must-have for smooth filming and I believe I made a great choice with this one.

I also like the fact that it comes with a phone adapter as well so if I am ever low on camera batteries I can easily attach my smartphone, adjust the weight, and I'll be ready to go.

I am still in the planning stages for my YouTube channel but I will use this awesome tool to stabilize live shots here in Boston, and from trying it out so far this mount has worked very well. customer_reviews.title: Sleek, simple, & useful!
customer_reviews.text: I think the product is great so far. It has a sleek & modern look to it. It feels sturdy and comfortable in my hand as I hold it. customer_reviews.title: This stabilizer has been really great so far
customer_reviews.text: This stabilizer has been really great so far. It does take a bit to figure out how to set it up but you can always look it up on the internet. The instructions it came with is just a transcript of a video, in which a URL to the video is provided in the manual. It does get a bit heavy after a while of holding the stabilizer with just one hand, so be sure not to mount too many things onto your camera, or use both of your hands carefully and interchangeably, or however you wish to not wear out your hand.

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, but more compact than other stabilzers
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice unit. I've never used any other stabilizer, so I have nothing to compare to, but I chose this one because it looked much smaller than others, thus I assumed it would be lighter. I was able to shoot an hour-long dance class without my arm getting too tired. There's online videos that teach you how to balance it, and the narrator commented that this can be problematic for some people, but he shows how it can be done in 5 minutes. Considering I'd never done anything like this, it didn't take me too long. I used it to video tape a friend teaching a dance class, and the footage came out very smooth and nice.

customer_reviews.title: Out of box impression

So far just been balancing it and working out the mechanics of its use so I’ll be prepared when it’s time to start shooting. Also the video tutorials were helpful in my purchasing decision. Can’t wait to get shooting but in the meantime I’m enjoying getting to know the gimbal. Will update after more use.

Does good job getting rid of sharp, image tearing-inducing shaking. Makes video look like the camera is gently gliding across the air. I have not tried the red version, but I'm very satisfied with Midnight Black LE variant so far.

customer_reviews.text: The design is very logical to do the job. Maybe it’s a little big for my camera bag, but I haven't tried yet to put it in. The color is amazing, I really love it. The size is appropriate for a camera stabilizer and the weight is great to handle the camera with one hand. The stabilizer feels amazing. It feels like the materials will last forever, it's sturdy and the build quality is great. The build quality is 10/10. great job.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: More complex than you might first expect
customer_reviews.text: Once you get it down it's a powerful tool, but it sure is a HUGE pain in the ass to balance (especially before you know what to expect), and the instructions included are insufficient to say the least. You'll be on youtube checking tutorials, and expect to spend an hour or two dicking around with it before you approach getting it balanced.
customer_reviews.author: PACMKE

customer_reviews.title: Very Simple yet Very Effective; lacks instructions
customer_reviews.text: This is a very simple yet very effective piece of equipment. Getting the equipment to work and learning how to work with it is as simple as watching a video or two on YouTube. However, I still have extra parts that to this day have not been identified because the manufacturer does NOT include any instructions or schematic in the box; I wonder what the extra parts are for and how these might make my experience better.
customer_reviews.author: FindTheIInTeam

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: It took a little bit to get my new Sony a6300 balanced, but once I did the stabilizer really made a difference in my video quality. The device is a quality product not too heavy and eliminated the little jerkiness from my videos trying to hand hold my camera. I did consider getting one of the new expensive motorized stabilizers, but I’m not a professional videographer, and this works great. Other options were too bulky for this casual user. I added a wired JJC remote Control to avoid having to touch the camera for shut off/on and zooming, and that works great with the stabilizer.
customer_reviews.author: M. Thew

customer_reviews.title: Not very user friendly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for the price. I am a beginner and did some research on inexpensive gimbals before I made this purchase. Once I recieved the product, I realized it is not as easy to use as you may see on videos. It is a constant balancing trick every time you go to use it. it takes a lot of getting used to being able to do the set up. I eventually broke down and spent the additional money for a powered gimbal. The product is not bad. It is made with sturdy and long lasting material, but it is definitely not for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get it
customer_reviews.text: Very good and sturdy, I unfortunately haven’t been able to use it as much as I’d like to but I highly recommend. But I would advise to buy it if you have the WiFi/blue room function on your camera. This was if you’re needing to stick your arm out for an action shot, you can take the picture with your phone remotely. I personally used this to take rollers of cars so it was great for that.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Not ideal for newer model GoPros
customer_reviews.text: There is not enough overall weight when used with a 117 gram GoPro. The results are not as stable as you'd want. ***Edit 9/24/18 Since writing this review, the seller has pleaded in two emails that I change it, even offering free things. I won't change the review. However, I will clarify that I was able to balance the GoPro Hero 6. Again, there just isn't enough overall weight in a GoPro to achieve good stability. Not a fault of the seller. A compact digital or SLR will work great with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Q

customer_reviews.title: High quality and very flexible.
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm very impressed with the stabilizer. I am just getting into creating videos and this is the first accessory I have purchased. Really nice unit, especially for the price! Lots of videos out there to help you get started with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kmp14

customer_reviews.title: Top notch customer service
customer_reviews.text: *UPDATE* I was contacted by the owner of Roxant who explained there have been counterfeit devices making their way into customers hands that have a screw in gimbal and are low quality. Clearly I was unlucky enough to receive one of those units. Customer service is great and it seems from the reviews that the item works wonderfully. Hopefully I'll have a chance to test an actual product at some point and leave a review on that. My camera disconnected from the Roxant multiple times. Ended up damaging the camera and never fully balanced. Ended up returning the item due to the issues, sad after seeing all the positive reviews. Hopefully you'll have better luck!
customer_reviews.author: rycette

customer_reviews.title: Very effective once it is balanced
customer_reviews.text: I tried out the stabilizer yesterday for the first time with an iPhone and love it. I had it balanced well and I was shooting at a skate park, and it kept things very smooth even while following while on my skateboard. I'm mostly interested in using it with my DSLR so the new handle is very interesting. I love the color and the overall profile. I've tried DIY versions but this is so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn M.

customer_reviews.title: Helps us amateurs make nice videos
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my sales team to do product videos. Needed something to stop with the shaky productions, yet had to be super easy to use. This product was the perfect solution. No electronic stuff to learn. Just simple cause and effect, move this get that. (you'll see what I mean when you watch the set up video) After a quick online tutorial, we were out on the lot filming.
customer_reviews.author: E. Varley

customer_reviews.title: Compact, sturdy stabilizer with excellent customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I chose Roxant's stabilizer because of the many good reviews I read on Amazon. The midnight black color of the stabilizer makes it look super professional, and the weight is perfect I think. The little weight plates located on the bottom of the stabilizer can be taken out so you can adjust how much weight you want to be attached depending on how heavy your device is. Overall, the stabilizer isn't too big so great for your vacation! I bought a stabilizer because I have my own YouTube channel and film vlogs on my travels quite often! I used to have super shaky videos so in order to step up the game, I decided to invest in a stabilizer.
customer_reviews.author: Cara

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best manual stabilizer in price range and class.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this with the Ulanzi Tripod Mount /Vertical Bracket Smartphone. Probably the best quality stabilizer for the price range. Made me realize now I want a DSLR/SLR Camera to take full advantage of Roxant camera shooting capabilities. Plenty of good online material to help with balancing issues, but easy to assemble and adjust. Thought about making my own, but then just figured I could modify this down the road if I want to make any other major adjustments. Glad I purchased it. After about 20 minutes of playing around I fined tuned it to get the smoothest video shots I ever taken,
customer_reviews.author: Jonny S

customer_reviews.title: Great Affordable Stabilizer
customer_reviews.text: The stabilizer looks good. It's more compact which I tend to prefer over the longer versions of stabilizers out there. I like the overall design but I wish there was a more ideal spot to put the second hand. The videos recommend a slight modification which I'll likely try out to remedy this. The black color is always preferable for me personally. It appears to be pretty sturdy which is important since I'm trusting it with my camera attached. I plan on utilizing it on my next short film. I didn't use any type of stabilizer on my last one and it was noticeable which is why I decided to get this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Very solid design. I'm shooting with a 5D Mark II and mostly rokinon cine primes or a tamron 24-70. With that combo, even though I've added extra washers to the stabilizer, it can't handle the weight. From what I've seen online it works well with lighter set-ups. Roxant did send out their larger handle to me for free, so that was a great bonus. I still use it but I can't get the really smooth glide effect you'll see in YouTube vids. And the glue that attaches a rubber grib to hold the top straight is wearing after about a month. Doesn't effect the unit, just a bit annoying.
customer_reviews.author: sean.digitalTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Very excited!!
customer_reviews.text: I am so excited to get started with my new stabilizer. I choose this product because it has good reviews and is very reasonably priced for a new guy like me. I have watched the set up video and I think I have it set.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: The look and feel of the Roxant pro is great the quality isn’t cheap, If you’re doing this for a heavy camera and lens then you’ll need the bigger handle because my 6d and 35mm sigma. Other than this it is a great product. Only gave a 4 Star because it isn’t strong enough for my camera, but with the upgraded handle it should be perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meh..
customer_reviews.text: It does ok, but honestly, with how cheap motorized gimbals are getting, I’d just save up for one of them. I used this thing a couple of times, now it just sits on a shelf. It does work, it’s just, have to re-balance for any little difference in weight is so time consuming. Motorized gimbals, you have to re-balance as well, but it doesn’t take anywhere near as long.
customer_reviews.author: BenJammin

customer_reviews.title: Great option, great value!
customer_reviews.text: My son is the one using this product. He is really enjoying it, it's very stable,color is sleek, seems durable and well made. It was an affordable option for the price ( he is still in school with limited income)! Thanks so much for the links to video tutorials, he is going to check them out as videos are also really helpful.
customer_reviews.author: yaffa

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Customer Service and Product

The issue with my order was more on Amazon and not Roxant - so shame on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Fun Brothers Gaming

Their follow-up via email and dedication to education about their product is impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Daran Chapman

customer_reviews.title: A must have for the series camera aficionado!

Compared to other devices in the market, to me this is a no-brainer and it's modestly price as well. Keep up the good work Roxant!!

customer_reviews.author: John Milner

customer_reviews.title: The device has a good build quality.

I also plan to add a quick connect so as to seamlessly transfer my camera from gimbal to hand held shooting. I used the DuPont Teflon Silicone Lubricant to remove the squeaking noise (which was quite audible in the first video i took). Update Returned it
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Its great!  Once you read the instructions

Works great now with my rebel 5ti! Its a process fine tuning and balancing 3 separate adjustments but its a fairly simple process of elimination that will drive you insane but, duke it out and you will not regret it. It's as smooth as everyone claims it is. The price was still a little steep for my liking but worth it in the end for this feel
customer_reviews.author: Fred Turgeston

customer_reviews.title: Really like it with my D7100

customer_reviews.author: william theroux

customer_reviews.title: Yay! A great product for our young film maker

I found the video tutorial very helpful, and was surprised at just how delicate the balance is, especially with a light phone (iPhone 8). I have found the gimble has some catchy spots, and with the low camera weight, I have to manually assist with light finger pressure to unstick it during some movements. I am a low budget story teller inside a big company with a huge marketing budget. My videos are kicking their ass thanks to my good motion shots. Ha, ha!
customer_reviews.author: Caj

I really love this stabilizer and wonder why I waited so long to get one. I would recommend this to my friends and I already have.

customer_reviews.author: David Entingh

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't Be Happier
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be happier. I purchased the Roxant because I wanted a smaller stabilizer that could be operated with one hand. After doing a couple shoots with it, I am very pleased. It does take a little while to get the balance right (their customer support emailed me with links to instructional videos before the unit arrived that were very helpful), and some practice, but after spending about 45 minutes with it I felt ready to go. It's light and small enough that I can take great video and still have camera maneuverability to take photos without having to detach it. I highly recommend the Roxant Pro to anyone looking for a small, compact stabilizer that gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made, stable and gets the job done!

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!

It takes more fussing with balance than the electronic gimbal. But I expect this gimbal will last longer, and be useable on more types of cameras. So, it is up to me to practice shooting vids using this old-fashioned, all-mechanical gimbal.
